name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course will examine different text types and acquaint students with the techniques and methodologies available in translating these texts. Attention will not only be given to usage, but also to issues of discourse. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.
schedule:
Week 1　　Introduction
Week 2　　(1) different text types and translation/(2) discourse analysis and translator
Week 3　　translation of journalistic texts (I)
Week 4　　translation of journalsitic texts (II)
Week 5　　translation of scientific and technical texts (I)
Week 6       translation of scientific and technical texts (II)
Week 7       N/A
Week 8　　translation of advertising texts (I)
Week 9       Mid-term 
Week 10　　translation of advertising texts (II)
Week 11     translation of tourism texts (I)
Week 12     translation of tourism texts (II)
Week 13     translaiton of commercial and financial texts (I); group presentation
Week 14     translaiton of commercial and financial texts (II); group presentation
Week 15　　translation of legal texts
Week 16　　transation of medical texts
Week 17　　Wrap up
Week 18　　Final exam
scorePolicy:
1. attendance & participation: 15%
2. translation quizzes: 24 %
3. translation assignments: 30%
4. a group presentation: 10%
5. final-exam: 25%
materials:
1. instructor’s lecture handouts
2. selected readings from the following books:
《文體與翻譯》（劉宓慶）；《翻譯初階》（周兆祥）；《傳媒翻譯》（鄭寶璇）；《新聞翻譯：原則與方法》（李德鳳）；Thinking Chinese Translation (Valerie Pellatt and Eric T. Liu)
